updates.details: The JASMIN Globus endpoint used for data transfers using the Globus online service will need to be replaced before mid-December. Exact dates TBC, please look out for further announcements if you use Globus to transfer data to/from JASMIN.

summary: Scheduled power maintenance: work now completed

updates.details: All systems reported to be operating normally, please report any issues to the relevant helpdesk.
LOTUS and ORCHID now at 99% of normal operation. Object Storage anticipated back in service on Monday. Please await further updates for full availability.
LOTUS cluster is now available, although with some nodes still out of service. ORCHID GPU cluster now has 4 nodes available. Please await further updates for full availability.

Most subsystems are now back up with the exception of SLURM (the scheduler used for LOTUS and ORCHID clusters) and  Object Storage. Login, (most) sci and xfer servers are accessible again, but any services reliant on LOTUS, Object Storage (e.g some web-based services) are not yet available. Please await further updates for full availability.
Eletrical work completed successfully over the weekend but JASMIN user services have not yet been restored.
Shutdown and electrical maintenance work in progress
Date announced alongside more information regarding shutdown and our impact reduction plan.
Further information will be shared in due course. We currently have limited information from our host institution.
Tape services currently unavailable, issue being investigated

summary: All services at risk due to network issue

updates.details: Network component failure overnight has caused temporary outages to many JASMIN and CEDA services. Interventions have been partially successful but those systems now working remain at risk. Some LOTUS jobs may have failed. *At risk* status likely to remain in place for some time (weeks) while a permanent solution is sought.
